text:
Customers choose AWS over other
providers because we have a lot

more functionality,
the largest and most vibrant

community of customers
and partners, and the most proven

operational and security
expertise.

For over 16 years, AWS has been
delivering cloud services

to millions of customers
around the world running
a wide variety of use cases.

And because we have the largest
and most dynamic community,

with millions of active customers
every month and more than 100,000

partners from over 150 countries,
there is a real network effect
when you use AWS.

Customers across virtually
every industry and of every

size, including startups,
enterprises, and public sector

organizations, are running
every imaginable use case on AWS.

This means that every AWS customer
has the opportunity to benefit

from all of the collaboration
and feedback we get from customers.

AWS is architected to be the
most flexible and secure cloud

computing environment
available today.

Our core infrastructure
is built to satisfy the security

requirements for the military,
global banks, and other high-sensitivity
organizations.

This is backed by a deep set
of cloud security tools, with

over 300 security, compliance,
and governance services
and features.

Additionally, 98 security
standards and compliance

certifications help satisfy
compliance requirements

for virtually every regulatory
agency across the globe.

But perhaps the most important
reason is that we’re unusually
customer focused.

A lot of companies will say this,
but very few walk the walk.

Most of the big technology
companies are competitor
focused.

They look at what their competitors
are doing, and they try to one-up
them.

That can be a successful
strategy, but it isn’t our strategy.

Ninety percent of what we build
is driven by what customers
ask us for.

The other 10 percent are things
we hear from customers

where they may not articulate
exactly what they want, but we’re

able to anticipate it and invent
on their behalf.

AWS, like all of Amazon,
is unusually long-term
oriented.

You won’t see our folks show
up at customers’ doors a day

before the end of the quarter
and try to harass them into
a sale.

We’re trying to build real relationships
and a business that lasts longer

than all of us, and we’ve learned
the way to do that is by doing

right by customers over a long
period of time.
